meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - It's Time to Get Wild!

I'm not saying I've been playing The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt for weeks on end (okay, who am I kidding? I totally have). But even a seasoned grog like me can't deny the addictive charm of this game. Now, I know what you're thinking - "What's with all the fancy words, reviewer?" Well, let me tell you, it's because I'm trying to be fancy... and also because I just learned some big words from my cat, Mr. Whiskers.

Now, onto the review! As a self-proclaimed gaming enthusiast (read: couch potato), I've got some opinions on this game. And honestly, I'm impressed - The Witcher 3 is a masterpiece of storytelling, world-building, and sheer awesomeness.

Let's start with the story, shall we? Geralt of Rivia returns in what feels like an epic conclusion to his journey (or so I've been told). The game takes you on a wild ride through a vast open world, filled with adventure, combat, and... did I mention adventure? Seriously though, the world is so immersive, you'll feel like you're right there with Geralt, battling monsters and making tough choices.

And then there's the combat - oh boy! It's like a dance party, minus the dancing (or music, for that matter). You get to swing your sword, cast spells, and use potions to take down foes. It might not be perfect, but it's definitely fun (and addictive... remember my cat Mr. Whiskers? Yeah, I think he's trying to tell me something).

Now, I know some critics (cough, cough - LEVEL, Eurogamer Poland) have given this game a 100%, and honestly, I can see why. The attention to detail is stunning, the art direction is breathtaking... it's like playing a dream! Even the not-so-fancy folks at Game Revolution gave it a solid score, even if they had some quibbles with the combat.

Of course, there are some downsides - it's a big game (like, really big), and sometimes you'll find yourself lost in its vast open world. But trust me, that's part of the charm! And hey, even Mr. Whiskers would agree (if he weren't too busy plotting his feline revolution).

So there you have it - The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt is a must-play for any RPG fan (or anyone looking for an epic adventure). It might not be perfect, but it's definitely wild... and worth getting lost in.

(Just don't tell Mr. Whiskers I said that; he thinks he's the only one who can pull off being cool.)
